title: Pride Of Britain Awards: Motsi Mabuse and Shirley Ballas arrive
text:
More than 100 of the UK's biggest stars have come together at the Daily Mirror Pride of Britain Awards to honour the nation's unsung heroes on the landmark 20th anniversary of the event.

And Strictly Come Dancing judges Motsi Mabuse and Shirley Ballas were sure to turn heads as they arrived in style at the Pride Of Britain Awards, which were held at Grosvenor House Hotel in London on Monday.

The judge, 38, looked sensational in a red chiffon gown, which had a daring thigh split and dramatically flared sleeves that cascaded to the floor.

Pride Of Britain Awards: Strictly judge Motsi Mabuse looked sensational in a red chiffon gown on the red carpet which was held at the Grosvenor House Hotel on Monday

Motsi striking red ensemble had a pleated design, and was cinched at the waist to accentuate her hourglass curves.

She added a touch of glitter to her ensemble by stepping out in a pair of gold strap heels, while she kept her personal items in a black clutch bag.

Motsi's brunette locks were brushed into a sleek, straight style, while she wore a glamorous palette of make-up and jewel earrings to complete the look.

Gorgeous: Motsi was joined by a chic Shirley Ballas at the event, who turned heads in a striking purple gown

Wow! Motsi striking red ensemble had a pleated design, and was cinched at the waist to accentuate her hourglass curves

Meanwhile, Shirley looked sensational in a purple one-shouldered gown that had a striking paisley pattern in a velvet material.

Her look was complete with a dazzling silver clutch bag, which she complemented with matching jewellery and heels.

The judge's raven tresses were brushed into a coiffed style, and she highlighted her stunning features by wearing a slick of red lipstick and black eyeliner.

Elegant: Shirley looked sensational in a purple one-shouldered gown that had a striking paisley pattern in a velvet material

Supportive: Motsi's sister Oti was also at the event alongside her Strictly dance partner Kelvin Fletcher, and she looked gorgeous in a sleeveless gold and black-feathered gown

The awards recognise and celebrate ordinary people up and down the country doing extraordinary things.

Hosted by Carol Vorderman, celebrities and public figures including Prince Charles, Robert Downey Jr, Sir Ben Kingsley, Dua Lipa, Ant & Dec, Chris Pratt, Michael Sheen, Adam Lambert, Christine Lampard, Sir Michael Caine, Jonathan Ross, Suranne Jones, and the judges and casts of Strictly Come Dancing and X Factor will be honouring this year's awe-inspiring winners.

Carol Vorderman said: 'Pride of Britain is such a huge part of my life, it's hard to believe it's 20 years since we first started. In that time, it has found a place at the heart of British life, and the winners represent the very best of us. I never fail to be humbled by them, and this year's are no different.'

The Daily Mirror Pride of Britain Awards, in partnership with TSB, will be broadcast on ITV on 5th November at 8pm.
